results.title: Lilydale: a change in pace
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: Presents two eras in the town of Lilydale in Victoria, the 1880’s and the 1980’s to form a case study of an Australian rural town as the metropolis advances towards it. It is a journey in time using archival photographs and diaries focusing particularly on the divergent life styles, attitudes and environments of the two eras of the district. Also includes a period recreation as a means to gain insights into those elements of Lilydale life. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch

results.title: Lily feeds a baby
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: An Aboriginal mother who is unable to feed her infant herself is shown how to prepare baby’s bottle under camp life conditions. Water is boiled over an open fire, the bottle and the teat sterilised and the milk prepared from powdered milk.

results.title: Lily Aime Moi = Lily, Love Me
results.brief_description:
Francois, a journalist, is ordered to write an article on the life of a working class man. This is how he meets Claude who has just been abandoned by his wife, Lily. Francois decide to put his job on the side and attempts to help Claude mend his relationship with Lily. The film follows for three days the adventures of two men who were never meant to meet while brushing a warm and ironic portrait of friendships, complicity and relationships.

Credits: Producer, Michel Seydoux ; director, Maurice Dugowson ; writer, Michel Vianey ; photography, Andre Diot ; music, Edgardo Canton.
Cast: Rufus, Jean-Michel Folon, Patrick Dewaere, Zouzou, Roland Dubillard, Juliette Creco, Andreas Voutsinas, Tatiana Moukhine, Roger Blin, Miou-Miou, Henry Jaglom.

results.title: Lilija Duks: weaver
results.creator_credit: Nina Syme, Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Lilija Duks is a weaver who came to Australia from Latvia. In this film she talks about both her own design work and the traditional Latvian weaving that she does.

results.title: Like you, like me: see what I feel
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
results.brief_description: An animated film which dramatises how a child copes with blindness. Designed to encourage discussion of attitudes toward the blind and to show that a blind or visually impaired child can do many things that other children do.

results.title: Like two mountaineers: the development of Cubism
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Ross Campbell
results.brief_description: Using examples from the Modern Masters exhibition, this film traces the early influences of Suerat, Cezanne and African art on the development of Cubism. Paintings of Picasso and Braque are shown in great detail from the period when they worked “like two mounaineers roped together”. No commentary, music soundtrack only. Suitable for upper secondary level.
